intro: Calea solidaginea subsp. deltophylla, commonly known as the "Mexican nightshade," is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom at night. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats and is known for its fragrant blossoms. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, edible berries. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
